intro: Cyrtandra bidwillii var. fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and can grow as an herb or small shrub. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it requires careful cultivation to thrive.
